name: py-pydata-sphinx-theme

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
A clean, three-column, Bootstrap-based Sphinx theme by and for the
PyData community.

dependencies.name: py-accessible-pygments
dependencies.description:
This package includes a collection of accessible themes for pygments
based on different sources.

dependencies.name: py-babel
dependencies.description:
Babel is an integrated collection of utilities that assist in
internationalizing and localizing Python applications, with an emphasis
on web-based applications.

dependencies.name: py-beautifulsoup4
dependencies.description:
Beautiful Soup is a Python library for pulling data out of HTML and XML
files. It works with your favorite parser to provide idiomatic ways of
navigating, searching, and modifying the parse tree.

dependencies.name: py-docutils
dependencies.description:
Docutils is an open-source text processing system for processing
plaintext documentation into useful formats, such as HTML, LaTeX, man-
pages, open-document or XML. It includes reStructuredText, the easy to
read, easy to use, what-you-see-is-what-you-get plaintext markup
language.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-pygments
dependencies.description: Pygments is a syntax highlighting package written in Python.

dependencies.name: py-sphinx-theme-builder
dependencies.description: A tool for authoring Sphinx themes with a simple (opinionated) workflow.

dependencies.name: py-typing-extensions
dependencies.description:
The typing_extensions module contains both backports of these changes as
well as experimental types that will eventually be added to the typing
module, such as Protocol (see PEP 544 for details about protocols and
static duck typing).

dependent_to.name: py-sphinx-book-theme
dependent_to.description:
Lightweight Sphinx theme designed to mimic the look-and-feel of an
interactive book.
